messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Bigger than Konos; not just Konos (was Re:Konos)
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s a huge difference between homeschoolers-who-happen-to-be-Christians and Christian homeschoolers.  You just have to meet a few of them to see the
messages.messageBody:
> <<"Christian homeschooler" indicates those intolerant fundamentalists.>>
>
> I find this statement extraordinary. There undoubtedly are many
> intolerant people, some of whom homeschool, of a variety of spiritual
> beliefs. But to assume that all people who call themselves
> homeschoolers *and* Christians are 'intolerant fundamentalists' is in
> itself incredibly intolerant and judgmental.

There's a huge difference between homeschoolers-who-happen-to-be-Christians
and Christian homeschoolers. You just have to meet a few of them to see the
difference.
Tia
leschke@...

"Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where
there is no path and leave a trail."
- Ralph Waldo Emerson
